result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrell V Leonard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May transfer Probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions and are to be filled at the same pharmacy.

Inform all treating physicians of this case. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from ADA Antoni Apollo from Milwaukee County

Defendant Jarrell V Leonard in court with Attorney Mark A. Pecora.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations. Attorney Pecora makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR    *Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions and all prescriptions are to be filled at same pharmacy
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Inform all treating physicians of this case.
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.


BUY MONEY:  $500.00- to Metro Drug Unit  (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  30 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

NOTE:  $500.00 cash bail posted is to be returned to poster
Sentencing hearing on June 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

(Fax) Dated today, from Atty Pecora's office to Judge Carter, requesting adjournment due to family emergency.
